page.title: 05RELIGION
page.content: There are many places of worship in Yateley. The Parish Church of St. Peters stands in the centre of old Yateley and there is also St. Barnabus and Darby Green which dates from 1889. Other services are also well attended at the Yately Centre. There is an active Mothers Union and several clubs for younger parishioners The Roman Catholic church is of modern design (1969) and there is a Union of Catholic Mothers. The Cricket Hill Baptist church was built about 1965 on the site of a former Baptish Church. The Methodist Church is in Sandhurst and is also supported by a Sunday School, Youth Fellowship and activities including Bible Study,Boys' and Girls' Brigades and a Women's group.
